_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

Three qualities of a well-known mendican: They encourage deeds of body that don’t reinforce good qualities.
They encourage deeds of speech that don’t reinforce good qualities.
They encourage principles that don’t reinforce good qualities.
They encourage deeds of body that reinforce good qualities.
They encourage deeds of speech that reinforce good qualities.
They encourage principles that reinforce good qualities.
